And Job spake, and said,

verses.text: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

similars.text: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.
What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.

verses.text: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.

similars.text: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies laugh among themselves.

verses.text: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.
The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

similars.text: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
For, behold, the beasts of the field and the fowls of the air, and that which cometh of the earth, is ordained for the use of man for food and for raiment, and that he might have in abundance.
And the Philistine said to David, Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the fowls of the air, and to the beasts of the field.
And it shall come to pass that the beasts of the forest and the fowls of the air shall devour them up.

I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life: and their dead bodies shall be for meat unto the fowls of the heaven, and to the beasts of the earth.
They shall be left together unto the fowls of the mountains, and to the beasts of the earth: and the fowls shall summer upon them, and all the beasts of the earth shall winter upon them.

Ye shall therefore put difference between clean beasts and unclean, and between unclean fowls and clean: and ye shall not make your souls abominable by beast, or by fowl, or by any manner of living thing that creepeth on the ground, which I have separated from you as unclean.

And, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord God; Speak unto every feathered fowl, and to every beast of the field, Assemble yourselves, and come; gather yourselves on every side to my sacrifice that I do sacrifice for you, even a great sacrifice upon the mountains of Israel, that ye may eat flesh, and drink blood.
And thy carcase shall be meat unto all fowls of the air, and unto the beasts of the earth, and no man shall fray them away.

And in that day will I make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven, and with the creeping things of the ground: and I will break the bow and the sword and the battle out of the earth, and will make them to lie down safely.
Him that dieth of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat: for the Lord hath spoken it.
Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.
Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

verses.text: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

similars.text: For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.
Therefore, go forth unto this people, and declare the words which I have spoken, unto the ends of the earth.
He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

And it shall come to pass, that the fishers shall stand upon it from En-gedi even unto En-eglaim; they shall be a place to spread forth nets; their fish shall be according to their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceeding many.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.

For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.

Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.
Neither is it beyond the sea, that thou shouldest say, Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it unto us, that we may hear it, and do it?

And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to observe and to do all his commandments which I command thee this day, that the Lord thy God will set thee on high above all nations of the earth:
Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt say.

Thus saith the Lord: In an acceptable time have I heard thee, O isles of the sea, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee; and I will preserve thee, and give thee my servant for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages;
And I give unto you a commandment that then ye shall teach them unto all men; for they shall be taught unto all nations, kindreds, tongues and people.
But lift thou up thy rod, and stretch out thine hand over the sea, and divide it: and the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

verses.text: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the Lord hath wrought this?

similars.text: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.
That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.

verses.text: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.

similars.text: Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.
And the spirit and the body are the soul of man.

verses.text: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?

similars.text: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.
For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

verses.text: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

similars.text: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;
With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
With whom took he counsel, and who instructed him, and taught him in the path of judgment, and taught him knowledge, and shewed to him the way of understanding?
He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
For the Lord giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?

verses.text: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

similars.text: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
And behold, also, if he say unto the waters of the great deep--Be thou dried up--it is done.
Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished:
And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dried up.
He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;
Behold, the Lord maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.
He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.
And the Gods ordered, saying: Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the earth come up dry; and it was so as they ordered;
And they thirsted not; he led them through the deserts; he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them; he clave the rock also and the waters gushed out.
He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

verses.text: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.

similars.text: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.
He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.
A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

verses.text: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

similars.text: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

verses.text: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.

similars.text: Then the king's countenance was changed, and his thoughts troubled him, so that the joints of his loins were loosed, and his knees smote one against another.

verses.text: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

similars.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

verses.text: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

similars.text: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
He hath put down the mighty from their seats, and exalted them of low degree.
Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

verses.text: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

similars.text: He revealeth the deep and secret things: he knoweth what is in the darkness, and the light dwelleth with him.
He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.
He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
He revealeth the deep and secret things: he knoweth what is in the darkness, and the light dwelleth with him.

verses.text: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.

similars.text: And he raiseth up a righteous nation, and destroyeth the nations of the wicked.
And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.
Thou hast increased the nation, O Lord, thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.
And he raiseth up a righteous nation, and destroyeth the nations of the wicked.

verses.text: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.

similars.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

verses.text: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.

similars.text: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits' end.
We grope for the wall like the blind, and we grope as if we had no eyes: we stumble at noonday as in the night; we are in desolate places as dead men.
They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
